description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Purchase_Item_Request_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Purchase_Item_Request_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Purchase_Item_Request_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: Purchase item request type is in use. You can only inactivate or update the name of an in use purchase item request type.
Enter a unique Order for each row.
Enter a different name for the request. You can't have more than 1 of the same name for active purchase item requests.

Submit a workbook template with only item inventory site attributes. When Calculate Recommended Reorder Point is enabled, you must submit workbook templates that only use the Item Inventory Site Attributes template type.
Request type cannot be enabled for Calculate Recommended Reorder Point and Request New Purchase Items.

Reorder the templates or select different templates because the current setup is invalid. More valid template combinations are available when you select only the Search and Select check box. 

Note: When you select a primary template with only supplier item information or only item inventory site attributes, you can’t select enrichment templates with purchase item information. A template with purchase item information must come before an enrichment template with inventory site attributes.
You can't have more than one worksheet template definition for the purchase item request type containing Alternate Item Identifiers with valid values.
